clinical_study.brief_title: Guanfacine for PONV and Pain After Sinus Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Guanfacine for PONV and Pain After Sinus Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) and pain are the most common causes of Post Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU) discharge delay, with untreated PONV occurring in 20-30% of post-surgical patients. The effect of guanfacine (GF) administration on pain and nausea scores will be assessed with two groups. One group will receive 1 mg of GF to take orally and the other group will receive a similar appearing placebo (containing no drug) to take orally.

detailed_description.textblock: Pain after surgery is commonly treated with narcotics which can potentiate PONV, further delaying PACU discharge. In multiple studies, alpha-2 agonists such as clonidine and dexmedetomidine reduce both the incidence of PONV and post-op pain, as well as requirements for postoperative analgesics. These actions are mediated via central alpha-2A receptors (A2AR). Of the A2AR agonists, guanfacine, though a weak antihypertensive agent, has the highest selectivity for the A2AR, but to date is untested for its potential to treat either PONV or post-operative pain.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of PONV Score of assessments done at 15, 30, and 60 minutes after arrival in PACU using 11-point nausea scale (nVRS)
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of PONV Score of assessments done at 15, 30, and 60 minutes after arrival in PACU using the nVRS when 0 is no nausea and 10 is worst nausea

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative nausea assessment using 11-point nausea scale (nVRS)
primary_outcome.description: PONV assessed using nVRS at 24 hours postop when 0 is no nausea and 10 is worst nausea.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum postoperative pain assessment using 11-point Visual/Verbal Analog (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum postoperative pain assessment assessed in PACU at 15, 30 and 60 minutes after PACU arrival using VAS when 0 is no pain and 10 is worst pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Postoperative pain assessment using 11-point Visual/Verbal Analog (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative pain assessment using VAS at 24 hours postop when 0 is no pain and 10 is worst pain

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time frame between arrival and discharge in PACU, approximately 90 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Total narcotic requirement in PACU tallied in morphine equivalents during PACU stay

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of doses of PONV treatment administered in PACU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time frame between arrival and discharge in PACU, approximately 90 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: PACU Length of Stay in minutes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time frame between arrival and discharge in PACU, approximately 90 minutes

arm_group.description: Guanfacine 1 mg capsule by mouth, one time prior to surgery.
Placebo with a similar appearance to guanfacine by mouth one time prior to surgery

intervention.description: Patients will receive 1 mg of guanfacine to take orally.
Patients will receive a placebo containing no drug that appears similarly to guanfacine to take orally.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- VUMC patients undergoing sinus surgery in MCE OR
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to read and freely consent
- Patients who take alpha-2 agonists routinely (guanfacine, clonidine, tizanidine)
- Patients undergoing sinus surgery planned for greater than 3 hours
- Patients with significant pre-existing pain, on chronic pain (opioid, methadone) therapy, severe fibromyalgia or other pre-existing pain condition in any body part
- Patients with preoperative nausea/vomiting at baseline.
- Pregnant or lactating women
